alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 10:08PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lancaster, Chesterfield and northeastern Kershaw Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cheraw Municipal Airport to near Heath Springs. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cheraw, Kershaw, Chesterfield, Heath Springs, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Westville, Cheraw State Park, Mt Pisgah, Northeastern Technical College, Cassatt, Cheraw Municipal Airport, Goodale State Park, Mcbee, Jefferson, Patrick, Bethune, North Central High School, Cheraw Fish Hatchery, Alligator Fire Station and Middendorf. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
